title: [FEATURE] call GC.AddMemoryPressure and GC.RemoveMemoryPressure?
body:
Each wrapped native object consumes memory, but the .NET garbage collector doesn't know about it.

It might make sense to call `GC.AddMemoryPressure` and `GC.RemoveMemoryPressure`, especially on objects that consume huge amounts of memory, like bitmaps, images, etc...

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: We probably should do this soon. We have image, bitmap, surface, data and memory streams.

comments.author: ziriax
comments.body:
This might be more tricky than it sounds. One really needs to track the memory usage of the [underlying shared pixel buffer](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/skia/include/core/SkPixelRef.h)

E.g. extracting a subset bitmap, or any call to [`SKBitmap::setPixelRef`](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/skia/include/core/SkBitmap.h;drc=6931add57da6fb7bde407366874fa26051c62263;bpv=1;bpt=1;l=754?originalUrl=https:%2F%2Fcs.chromium.org%2F) shares the same memory

So ideally, the `SKPixelRef` should be tracked, that would cover a lot of cases; it would be handy if that native class had some global alloc'd/free'd events
